{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided, the patient is a 24-year-old woman at 24 weeks' gestation with a normal ultrasound scan and an uncomplicated pregnancy. The next step in management would be to perform a swab for Group B Streptococcus (GBS) culture. GBS is a common bacteria that can be present in the vagina and rectum of pregnant women. It can be transmitted to the baby during delivery and cause serious infections. Therefore, it is recommended to screen all pregnant women for GBS colonization between 35 and 37 weeks' gestation. This will help determine if the patient needs intrapartum antibiotic prophylaxis to prevent GBS transmission to the baby.", "answer_choice": "C"}
